intro: Coussapoa microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed cupuaçu, is a species of tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces a fruit similar to the cupuaçu, which is used in traditional medicine and as a source of edible pulp. Its botanical features include a woody stem, hairy leaves, and a unique fruit structure that aids in seed dispersal. Coussapoa microcephala plays an important ecological role in its habitat, supporting various wildlife species.
